text: Andrea Ciccione (1388–1455), also known as Andrea di ciao Italian architect and sculptor of the Renaissance. He was born and died in Florence, but spent much of his career in Naples. He trained under Masuccio the Younger. He completed the tomb of King Ladislaus of Naples at San Giovanni a Carbonara in Naples. ==References== Category:1388 births Category:1455 deaths Category:People from Florence Category:15th-century Italian architects Category:Italian Renaissance architects Category:Architects from Naples Category:15th-century Italian sculptors Category:Italian male sculptors Category:Renaissance sculptors
title: Andrea Ciccione
